Issues.Title: `calc()` not normalizing
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.3.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

PostCSS `8.4.27`
PostCSS Loader `6.2.1`
Webpack `5.88.2`

Also reproduced in Tailwind Play (see below)

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

`16.13.0`

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

Windows

**Reproduction URL**

https://play.tailwindcss.com/7lVcDok0HN

**Describe your issue**

Unfortunately, I come bearing a case where `calc()` value is not properly normalized in an arbitrary value:

`[--foo:calc((704-320)/(1400-782))]`

Which I then extrapolated to more cases to try to narrow down a pattern:

‚ùå `w-[calc((7-32)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((7-3)/(1400-782))]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((7-32)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((70-3)/(1400-782))]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((70-32)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((704-3)/(1400-782))]`
‚úÖ `[--foo:calc((704-320))]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((704-320)/1)]`
‚ùå `[--foo:calc((704-320)/(1400-782))]`

For the classes marked with a cross (‚ùå), there is no space around the subtraction operator (`-`) in the first set of parentheses in the generated CSS rule value, causing the `calc()` value to be invalid.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`calc()` not normalizing" (#11682)

Issues.Body:

Release Notes

3.34.0 (from changelog)

  • Add CLI options for all remaining Sucrase options, e.g. --disable-es-transforms for disableESTransforms. (<<-ArS, Alan Pierce) (#670, #812)
  • Add SUCRASE_OPTIONS environment variable for configuring sucrase/register, sucrase-node, and any programmatic require hook usages. The value must be a valid JSON object of Sucrase options that will be merged with the usual options. (#813)

3.33.0 (from changelog)

  • Add an option keepUnusedImports that disables all automatic import/export elision, equivalent to the TypeScript option verbatimModuleSyntax. (#811, #615) (Kotaro Chikuba, Alan Pierce)
  • Add support for the await using proposal and the updated import attributes proposal. Both are preserved in the output code, not transformed. (#798)
  • Fix some issues with TypeScript automatic export elision in export {...} from statements. (#806)
    • Type names from the current file are no longer removed.
    • When all exports are type exports, the entire statement is now removed.
  • Fix bug where fn(x < y, x >= y) was incorrectly parsed as type arguments. (#798)
  • Fix a few bugs in enableLegacyBabel5ModuleInterop: properly handle as default, and properly ignore type exports. (#804, #807) (‰∏âÂí≤Êô∫Â≠ê Kevin Deng, Alan Pierce)
  • Fix bug where parameters inside function types could be misinterpreted as declarations and result in imports being incorrectly marked as unused. (#809)
  • Fix bug where import {} and export {} statements were removed with the TypeScript transform disabled. (#810)
  • Make the transform behavior more forgiving when code accidentally has a return type annotation on a constructor. (#800)

Does any of this look wrong? Please let us know.

Issues.Title: Support async functions in tailwind.config
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

"tailwindcss": "3.3.3"

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

"next": "13.4.10",

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

‚ùØ node -v
v18.13.0

**What browser are you using?**

chrome, NA

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/sramam/zz-tailwind-config-async


**Describe your issue**
I need to load files and process in a tailwind plugin. The processing is an async operation
and, making the plugin an async function. `tailwind.config.ts` doesn't seem to like async functions. 

The repo above provides the smallest reproduction I could make to illustrate the issue.

To reproduce:
```
git clone https://github.com/sramam/zz-tailwind-config-async
cd zz-tailwind-config-async
pnpm install
pnpm dev
```
visit [https://localhost:3000](https://localhost:3000)

edit `tailwind.config.ts` [Line 41](https://github.com/sramam/zz-tailwind-config-async/blob/main/tailwind.config.ts#L41):

```
-   theme: asyncTheme(),
+   theme: syncTheme(),
```

Notice the orange text background.

## Desired Behavior
The async function not just for themes, but plugins and everywhere else, should work like the sync versions.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support async functions in tailwind.config " (#11655)

Issues.Title: Mismatch of matchVariant type definition from implementation
Issues.Body:
Hi Tailwind maintainers! This is my first issue opened on the repo, so if there is anything I'm missing that would be helpful, let me know. I came across this while implementing a custom plugin that needed to walk the rules to find a particular declaration.

The implementation of `matchVariant` exposes `container` alongside `modifier`:

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/6eed8cb3f6e9673990d1773b8b0e2cf5f1b3a02e/src/lib/setupContextUtils.js#L591
https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/6eed8cb3f6e9673990d1773b8b0e2cf5f1b3a02e/src/lib/setupContextUtils.js#L613-L620

However, the type definition does not include `container` in the callback function arguments:

https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/blob/6eed8cb3f6e9673990d1773b8b0e2cf5f1b3a02e/types/config.d.ts#L314-L324

That results in a mismatch when defining my config file with TypeScript.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mismatch of matchVariant type definition from implementation" (#11664)

Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

Remix v1.18.1

v18

Chrome

macOS

The `drop-shadow` utility class is not working correctly. 

It's producing this class:
```css
.drop-shadow-2xl {
  --tw-drop-shadow: drop-shadow(0 25px 25px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15));
  filter: var(--tw-blur) var(--tw-brightness) var(--tw-contrast) var(--tw-grayscale) var(--tw-hue-rotate) var(--tw-invert) var(--tw-saturate) var(--tw-sepia) var(--tw-drop-shadow);
```

When it should be the one below (according to the docs):
```css
filter: drop-shadow(0 25px 25px rgb(0 0 0 / 0.15));
```

Issues.Title: appearance-none does not remove basic arrow from select - Tailwind CSS : v3.2.2 - Standalone CLI
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

Tailwind CSS : v3.2.2 - Standalone CLI

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Standalone CLI build using the watcher
`./tailwindcss -i input.css -o output.css --watch
`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

N/A

**What browser are you using?**

Browser : Tested on Firefox and Chrome (same result on both)

**What operating system are you using?**

Browser on Windows
App on WSL2 Linux Ubuntu

**Reproduction URL**

Reproduction: https://play.tailwindcss.com/u66vWQGziq?size=540x720
The bug does not occure on tailwind playground but the setup and code are exactly the same as my app.

**Describe your issue**

Using `appearance-none` in the `select ` class  does not remove the base arrow of the select. Other strange phenomena : using `bg-none` remove the arrow with or without `appearance-none`. Since the same code works fine in the playground this might be an issue with the standalone CLI ?

Issues.Title: TailwindCSS drop-shadow property creates a new stacking context and overlaps elements with a z-index
Issues.Body: **What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.3.2 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Nuxt 3 **What version of Node.js are you using?** v18.16.0 **What browser are you using?** Chrome **What operating system are you using?** Windows with WSL2 **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/B0c0nVZYRA **Describe your issue** The drop-shadow TailwindCSS class creates a new [stacking context](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_positioned_layout/Understanding_z-index/Stacking_context) because of the usage of filter(). In my project I have a card component with a drop-shadow. In this card component I have dropdown components and when they open another card component directly below them overlaps the dropdown menu.
